title: Stack level too deep by circular error causes
body:
#### Description

When having Errors with circular causes, Sidekiq performs an infinite recursion. In some cases you want to handle your errors in a way that creates those circular causes. You can see the ruby and sidekiq versions in the sidekiq output below. The Rails version is in the section "Execution".

```
❯ redis-cli --version
redis-cli 2.8.19
```
#### Code

``` ruby
class ErrorsDemoWorker
  include Sidekiq::Worker

  def perform
    ErrorsDemo.new.call
  end
end
```

``` ruby
class ErrorsDemo
  class OriginalError < ::StandardError; end
  class OurError < ::StandardError; end
  class NotOurError < ::StandardError; end

  def call
    call_working_method
  rescue NotOurError => e
    raise e.cause
  end

  def call_working_method
    do_some_work
  rescue OriginalError => e
    if our_error?(e)
      raise OurError, 'please handle this'
    else
      raise NotOurError, 'just propagate this'
    end
  end

  def do_some_work
    raise OriginalError, 'this is not our error'
  end

  def our_error?(error)
    error.message == 'this is our error'
  end

  def call_and_rescue
    call
  rescue => e
    e.object_id == e.cause.cause.object_id
  end
end
```
#### Execution

```
❯ rails c
Loading development environment (Rails 4.1.1)
irb(main):001:0> ErrorsDemo.new.call_and_rescue
=> true
irb(main):002:0> ErrorsDemoWorker.perform_async
=> "25ae512b1b97d2b0d6034057"
```

#### Suggestion

In [master/lib/sidekiq/middleware/server/retry_jobs.rb](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/be7d77d9eddc2fdd818ef7bd4c31b6e897c93859/lib/sidekiq/middleware/server/retry_jobs.rb#L191-197), add an array of already checked `object_id`s to the method `exception_caused_by_shutdown?` and only call itself if the `cause.object_id` is not yet in the array:

``` ruby
        def exception_caused_by_shutdown?(e, checked_causes = [])
          # In Ruby 2.1.0 only, check if exception is a result of shutdown.
          return false unless defined?(e.cause)

          # Handle circular causes
          checked_causes << e.object_id
          return false if checked_causes.include?(e.cause.object_id)

          e.cause.instance_of?(Sidekiq::Shutdown) ||
            exception_caused_by_shutdown?(e.cause, checked_causes)
        end
```
